title: 14.2 How to Augment a Data Structure
content:
Section 14.2

How to Augment a Data Structure

Summary

A systematic method for adding information to data structures.

Key Points

  • Step 1: Choose underlying data structure
  • Step 2: Determine additional information to maintain
  • Step 3: Verify info can be maintained during modifications
  • Step 4: Develop new operations using the info
  • Theorem: if info depends only on node and children, can maintain in O(1) per rotation

Example

For order statistics: use red-black tree, add size field, update size on rotations, implement SELECT and RANK.

Why It Matters

General technique applicable to many data structure design problems.
